revised_title: Experiments on Restoration of Paralyzed Muscles through Nerve Anastomosis
tldr: The study investigates the restoration of paralyzed muscles through nerve anastomosis, confirming previous findings and demonstrating the effectiveness of anastomosis in restoring voluntary movements in facial muscles. The research also highlights the differences between using the spinal accessory and hypoglossal nerves as substitutes and the importance of the interval between nerve division and anastomosis.
